title: Liverpool news: James Milner compares Jurgen Klopp to Alex Ferguson in one key area
text:
Jurgen Klopp has led Liverpool to the top of the Premier League table (Picture: Getty Images)

James Milner believes Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is similar to Manchester United legend Sir Alex Ferguson in the way he uses the media to get ahead of opponents.

Klopp has been a huge hit on Merseyside since arriving in 2015, lifting the Champions League trophy last season and currently sitting top of the Premier League.

The German is yet to get his hands on a domestic title with the Reds, but is hugely popular among the Anfield faithful.

Part of this is down to his passion and enthusiasm on the touchline and when he appears in the media, something that Milner insists is not put on, and is part of Klopp’s long-term plans to win games.

‘The manager is pretty much “what you see is what you get’,” Milner told talkSPORT. ‘He doesn’t have a front for the cameras where he’s different behind closed doors to the players.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He has that jokey side with us, but he can also stick the boot in as well. He demands the best and demands the highest standards, and I think he has changed a bit over the last few years since he came in.

‘He’s realised he can relax a bit more at times around the squad, but the characters in the squad and the players he’s got aren’t going to take the foot off the gas.

‘We work very hard and in every single training session he demands the best. You can see from him bouncing around on the sidelines how much it means to him, and he wants to be out on that field sometimes.

‘He loves the press conferences as well; I think he’s the same as some older managers, like Sir Alex, as he thinks the battle starts there.

‘He gives 100 per cent every single day and has been fantastic for the club since he’s been here.’

Sir Alex Ferguson is some way ahead of Klopp in terms of titles (Picture: Getty Images)

Liverpool are unbeaten in the Premier League this season and return to domestic action on Sunday at home to Tottenham after a comfortable 4-1 win over Genk in the Champions League on Wednesday.

The ever-reliable Milner started that game at right-back and ended it at left-back as he demonstrated his incredible versatility once again.

The 33-year-old is out of contract at the end of the season and is yet to sign a new deal, remaining coy on his future.

‘Who knows, you know?’ Milner said at a press conference ahead of Liverpool’s Champions League clash with Genk.

‘There have been talks so hopefully it gets resolved sooner rather than later. But at this moment I will just keep playing football as well as I can.’
